page.title: 09Whittington Near Kinver
page.content: Whittington is a hamlet to the south of Kinver lying between the canal and the A449 road. There is a canal lock, a post office, public house, garage, horticultural nursery, sewage works and Whittington Hall. Whittington Hall was built in the reign of George 2nd on the site of an earlier house. It is built of red bricks. The inn is called the Â£Dick Whittington'. It used to be Whittington Manor House and dates from 1310. Parts of the half-timbering and wattle and daub remain. On the front door is an emblem showing Queen Anne stayed there. There is a priest's hole. There is supposed to be a secret staircase leading to a room where King Charles 2nd hid after the Battle of Worcester but it has not been found yet
